Active effects function the same way as always. Some quality-of-life changes have been made to enhance the use of them in this system.

Name Overrides

When using the name attribute key and the Override change mode, any instance of the substring '{}' in the effect value will be replaced with the target's current name. E.g., an item named 'Battleaxe' affected by a change with the value 'Cool {} of Doom' will have its name changed to 'Cool Battleaxe of Doom'.

Affecting Sets

Normally when targeting a Set of strings, the effect value of the change has to be very particular, e.g., ["magical", "ammunition", "rending"]. In this system, you can instead simply write

magical, ammunition, rending

In addition, if you wish to remove a key from the Set, you can prepend the key with '-'. E.g., magical, ammunition, -rending will add the magical and ammunition attributes and remove the rending attribute.

Enrichers are inline text that gets formatted automatically. The system has some additional enrichers.

Lookup

The "lookup" enricher will replace a string of roll data with the relevant property inside text. In addition, @name is added to actor and item roll data. For example, on a monster called 'Captain' who has 55 total hit points, the following string,

This monster is called [[lookup @name]]
and has [[lookup @health.max]] total health.

will output as "The monster is called Captain and has 55 total health."
